The Scottish Government

The responsibilities of the Scottish Government include health, education, justice, rural affairs, housing and the environment.

To keep up to date with the National Conversation follow us on Twitter or like us on Facebook.

Healthier Scotland

You are invited to have your say on what a healthier Scotland should look like in the next 10 to 15 years and the steps that could be taken to make this vision a reality.

Healthier Scotland Blog

"Since we took the necessary decision to close the Forth Road Bridge on safety grounds, the patience and co-operation displayed by the travelling public and affected businesses is appreciated, but there is no doubt people will continue to experience disruption over this period."

Transport Minister Derek Mackay

Forth Bridge closure

The Forth Road Bridge will be shut until the new year for repairs following the discovery of defective steelwork.

Please plan journeys carefully to allow time for longer journey times.

Full details of rail services, frequent park & ride services and road diversion routes, are on Traveline Scotland

  • Plan your travel on Traffic Scotland
  • Follow Traffic Scotland on Twitter
  • Latest travel news on Transport Scotland
More on Forth Bridge closure

"I am delighted that Mairi Hedderwick was able to create such a wonderful illustration for this year's Christmas card."

First Minister Nicola Sturgeon

Christmas card

A special festive illustration of Katie Morag features on the front of the First Minister's 2015 official Christmas card. The festive illustration shows Katie Morag welcoming children from around the world to the First Minister's official residence, Bute House.

Read the news release

About government

First Minister

As head of the Scottish Government, the First Minister is responsible for the overall development, implementation and presentation of the administration's policies and for promoting and representing Scotland at home and overseas.

Nicola Sturgeon is Scotland's first female First Minister and the first woman to lead any of the devolved UK administrations.

Read biography

How government works

There are a total of 23 ministers that make up the Scottish Government.

1First Minister 7Cabinet Secretaries 13Other Ministers
